security: This material contains information effecting the National Defense of the United States within the meaning of the Espionage Laws, Title 18, U.S.C Secs. 793 and 794, he transmission or revelation of which in any manner to an unauthorized person is prohibited by law.
summary: Cuban officials in Santiago, Chile commented on the assassination of President Kennedy, with concerns about potential repercussions and blame being placed on Cuba by the U.S. government.
summary_one_paragraph: On November 22, 1963, Cuban Embassy officials in Santiago, Chile, reacted to the news of President Kennedy's assassination, expressing concerns about the potential for serious repercussions and a possible third world war if the U.S. blamed Cuba, with José Toha noting the situation 'looks like it could have serious repercussions'; Pedro Martinez Pirez commented on the possibility of the U.S. invading Cuba, highlighting existing tensions and perceived contradictions; the Cuban Consul at Valparaiso inquired about flying the flag at half-mast, and Martinez denied the assassin's involvement with the Fair Play for Cuba Committee, suggesting right-wing extremists were to blame and anticipating U.S. attempts to incriminate Cuba.
title: Comments of Cuban Officials on the Assassination of President Kennedy
sender: SMITH, ALEXANDER, BELES, HAB47, BRUBECK, DINGEMAN, KOMER, SAUNDERS, SCHLESINGER, SMITH, WM. Y.
